key_points: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi proposes a 9/11-style commission to investigate the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.
The suggested commission aims to be bipartisan, echoing the structure and spirit of the 9/11 Commission.
It seeks to examine the riot's causes, including Trump's role and the failure of Capitol security.
The commission would also explore potential external influences, including claims of infiltration by extremist groups.
The necessity of including a wide political spectrum in the commission's membership is emphasized.
The op-ed stresses the importance of genuine bipartisan cooperation for the commission's credibility.
Investigating Pelosi's decisions related to the events is also considered important for the commission's integrity.
Maintaining neutrality and seeking truth over partisan gains are highlighted as essential for the commission's success.
The piece argues that a well-executed commission could help bridge America's political divisions.
The value of discomfort in the pursuit of truth is acknowledged as part of the commission's process.
